comment: If Johnnie Walker Blue were a bourbon; super smooth, not too sweet

Color: light roasted sugar
Nasal: orange liquor, almonds and chives
Taste: orange, vanilla, cinnamon, and lemon tea
6-28-17 smoother start than part 1. 3.9. Do like better but both very drinkable
I have pact 3. Very smooth but pricey at 100/bottle.
Le pact 3 est tres bien coté dans whisky advocate

I gave this 3.5/5 because I do not like it as well as Pact 1, & this bottle really opens up with time. 

UPDATE... 2-14-18 OPENS UP REALLY WELL only gets better with time😁😁😁😁
but I liked 1 better
Very tasty bourbon.  Just don't know if it's worth the over $200 a bottle price.

N: Sweet brown sugar and orange oil. Like an old fashioned with lingering ethanol 
P: Viscous brown sugar and orange peel turns into a baking spice and oak
F: forgettable lingering oak that is very drying

Nose is bright and sweet, with notes of brown sugar and orange peel. The palate is soft but full of flavor with a bit of heat. More orange sweetness and a bit of ginger. Light smoke on the finish that is medium short.
